title: ryx
text: ryx one helpful function, three useful methods, can used understand correlations data. vignette walk use function methods. example output ryx function printed. output provides information variable used, correlation variable y variable specified, p-value correlation, significance level, shown stars. scale stars *** < 0.001, ** < 0.01, * < 0.05. Variables statistically significant stars. x variables specified, function provide output numeric variables provided dataset. example specify x variables within function. modified correlation table, shows correlations medv four specified x variables. Beyond printed output, ryx also comes summary function, provides users basic information many variables used, many significant, variables used, median absolute correlation, range correlation values. example summary function. Additionally, function provides plot function, can used visualize correlations. example output plot function.
code: library(ryx) library(MASS) x <- ryx(Boston, y = "medv") x #> Correlations of medv with #>  variable          r            p sigif #>     lstat -0.7376627 5.081103e-88   *** #>        rm  0.6953599 2.487229e-74   *** #>   ptratio -0.5077867 1.609509e-34   *** #>     indus -0.4837252 4.900260e-31   *** #>       tax -0.4685359 5.637734e-29   *** #>       nox -0.4273208 7.065042e-24   *** #>      crim -0.3883046 1.173987e-19   *** #>       age -0.3769546 1.569982e-18   *** #>        zn  0.3604453 5.713584e-17   *** #>     black  0.3334608 1.318113e-14   *** #>       dis  0.2499287 1.206612e-08   *** x <- ryx(Boston, y = "medv", x = c("black", "zn", "age", "crim")) x #> Correlations of medv with #>  variable          r            p sigif #>      crim -0.3883046 1.173987e-19   *** #>       age -0.3769546 1.569982e-18   *** #>        zn  0.3604453 5.713584e-17   *** #>     black  0.3334608 1.318113e-14   *** x <- ryx(Boston, y = "medv") summary(x) #> Correlating medv with crim zn indus nox rm age dis tax ptratio black lstat  #> The median absolute correlation was 0.427 with a range from -0.738 to 0.695 #>  11 out of 11 variables where significant at the p < 0.05 level. plot(x)

title: Correlation Table Summary — summary.ryx
code: library(MASS) x <- ryx(Boston, y = "medv") summary(x) #> Correlating medv with crim zn indus nox rm age dis tax ptratio black lstat  #> The median absolute correlation was 0.427 with a range from -0.738 to 0.695 #>  11 out of 11 variables where significant at the p < 0.05 level. x <- ryx(iris, y = "Sepal.Length") summary(x) #> Correlating Sepal.Length with Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width  #> The median absolute correlation was 0.818 with a range from -0.118 to 0.872 #>  2 out of 3 variables where significant at the p < 0.05 level.
